PROD321.name: Lab submissions
PROD321.description: 1% Per Lab. Grade will be allocated as lab work complete (1%) or incomplete (0%). Work must beshown to Sabrina within 7 days of the end of the lab session to be awarded the mark.

PROD321.name: Assignment 1 â€“ 3D Graphics Programming
PROD321.description: Students will be required to design three dimensional graphical environments and implement them using techniques covered in Foundations of Computer Graphics and Advanced Techniques in 3D Graphics

PROD321.name: Assignment 2 - Visibility Determination and Animation
PROD321.description: Students will design and create a playable game using techniques learned in Rendering Pipelines and Optimisations, controlling a character animated using techniques learned in Animation

PROD321.name: Assignment 3 - Shaders
PROD321.description: Students will work through a series of programming tasks to gain experience developing their own shaders in Cg/HLSL

SENG201.name: Project
SENG201.description: Normally a small-scale soware development project using JavaFX; done in pairs.

SENG201.name: Final Exam
SENG201.description: Normally a computer-based, 2-hour exam; calculators are not allowed; ques ons will assume knowledge expected to have been gained through prac cal work and may be based on examples introduced in labs or the project.
